00139 #include "zesto-structs.h"
00140 
00141 /* state for the processor microarchitecture (per core) */
00142 class core_t {
00143 
00144   friend class core_oracle_t;
00145 
00146 /* (See get_uop_array/return_uop_array functions)
00147    The following struct and the functions after that are for
00148    implementing our own "malloc/free" for the uop arrays.  The
00149    original Mop_t implementation contained a static uop_t array
00150    sized for the worst-case flow, which caused the Mop_t struct to
00151    be very large and unwieldly.
00152 
00153    The outside world just wants a struct uop_t *, but
00154    uop_array_pool has additional fields (namely the size and a
00155    pointer for chaining all of the free entries together).  This
00156    unfortunately means that when you return the struct uop_t * to
00157    the free pool we have to do some ugly pointer munging to get the
00158    address of the overall uop_array_pool struct.  However, you'll
00159    be fine if you just use the interface functions, and you
00160    probably don't even need to do that. */
00161   struct uop_array_t {
00162     int size; /* 4 bytes */
00163     struct uop_array_t * next; /* 4 bytes */
00164     int padding0; /* 4 bytes */
00165     int padding1; /* 4 bytes  - want uop array to start aligned to 16 bytes */
00166     struct uop_t uop[0]; /* we calloc different sized arrays and use this as the
00167                             base for the array (see the original simplescalar
00168                             cache data block structure) */
00169   };
00170 
00171   public:
00172 
00173   /* pointer to configuration information */
00174   struct core_knobs_t * knobs;
00175 
00176   /********************************/
00177   /* "ISA" STATE (used by oracle) */
00178   /********************************/
00179   struct thread_t * current_thread;
00180   int id; /* core-id */
00181 
00182   /*Pointer to the uncore of this core*/
00183   struct uncore_t * uncore;
00184 
00185   counter_t num_emergency_recoveries;
00186   int last_emergency_recovery_count; /* inst count at last recover to detect an unrecoverable situation */
00187 
00188   /***************************/
00189   /* MICROARCHITECTURE STATE */
00190   /***************************/
00191 
00192   class core_oracle_t * oracle;
00193   class core_fetch_t * fetch;
00194   class core_decode_t * decode;
00195   class core_alloc_t * alloc;
00196   class core_exec_t * exec;
00197   class core_commit_t * commit;
00198 
00199   struct core_memory_t {
00200     struct cache_t * IL1;
00201     struct cache_t * ITLB;
00202 
00203     struct cache_t * DL1;
00204     struct cache_t * DL2;
00205     struct bus_t * DL2_bus; /* connects DL1 to DL2 */
00206     struct cache_t * DTLB;
00207     struct cache_t * DTLB2;
00208     struct bus_t * DTLB_bus; /* connects DTLB to DTLB2 */
00209 
00210   } memory;
00211 
00212   /**********************/
00213   /* VARIOUS STATISTICS */
00214   /**********************/
00215 
00216   struct core_stat_t {
00217     tick_t final_sim_cycle; /* number of cycles when inst-limit reached (for multi-core sims) */
00218     /* fetch stage */
00219     counter_t fetch_bytes;
00220     counter_t fetch_insn;
00221     counter_t fetch_uops;
00222     counter_t fetch_eff_uops;
00223     counter_t byteQ_occupancy;
00224     counter_t predecode_bytes;
00225     counter_t predecode_insn;
00226     counter_t predecode_uops;
00227     counter_t predecode_eff_uops;
00228     counter_t IQ_occupancy;
00229     counter_t IQ_uop_occupancy;
00230     counter_t IQ_eff_uop_occupancy;
00231     counter_t IQ_full_cycles;
00232     counter_t IQ_empty_cycles;
00233     struct stat_stat_t *fetch_stall;
00234 
00235     /* decode stage */
00236     counter_t target_resteers;
00237     counter_t phantom_resteers;
00238     counter_t override_pred_resteers;
00239     counter_t decode_insn;
00240     counter_t decode_uops; /* uops - a set of fused uops only count as a single effective uop */
00241     counter_t decode_eff_uops; /* counts individual uops (fused or not) */
00242     counter_t uopQ_occupancy;
00243     counter_t uopQ_eff_occupancy;
00244     counter_t uopQ_full_cycles;
00245     counter_t uopQ_empty_cycles;
00246     struct stat_stat_t *decode_stall;
00247 
00248     /* alloc stage */
00249     counter_t alloc_insn;
00250     counter_t alloc_uops;
00251     counter_t alloc_eff_uops;
00252     struct stat_stat_t *alloc_stall;
00253 
00254     /* exec stage */
00255     counter_t exec_uops_issued;
00256     counter_t exec_uops_replayed;
00257     counter_t exec_uops_snatched_back;
00258     counter_t RS_occupancy;
00259     counter_t RS_eff_occupancy;
00260     counter_t RS_full_cycles;
00261     counter_t RS_empty_cycles;
00262     counter_t num_jeclear;
00263     counter_t num_wp_jeclear; /* while in shadow of earlier mispred */
00264     counter_t load_nukes; /* pipe-flushes due to load-order violation */
00265     counter_t wp_load_nukes;
00266     counter_t DL1_load_split_accesses;
00267 
00268     /* commit stage */
00269     counter_t commit_bytes;
00270     counter_t commit_insn;
00271     counter_t commit_uops;
00272     counter_t commit_eff_uops;
00273     counter_t commit_fusions;
00274     counter_t commit_refs;
00275     counter_t commit_loads;
00276     counter_t commit_branches;
00277     counter_t commit_traps;
00278     counter_t commit_rep_insn;
00279     counter_t commit_rep_iterations;
00280     counter_t commit_rep_uops;
00281     counter_t commit_UROM_insn;
00282     counter_t commit_UROM_uops;
00283     counter_t commit_UROM_eff_uops;
00284     counter_t DL1_store_split_accesses;
00285 
00286     counter_t eio_commit_insn; /* num instructions consumed in EIO file */
00287 
00288     counter_t commit_deadlock_flushes;
00289 
00290     /* occupancy stats */
00291     counter_t ROB_occupancy;
00292     counter_t ROB_eff_occupancy;
00293     counter_t ROB_full_cycles;
00294     counter_t ROB_empty_cycles;
00295     counter_t LDQ_occupancy;
00296     counter_t LDQ_full_cycles;
00297     counter_t LDQ_empty_cycles;
00298     counter_t STQ_occupancy;
00299     counter_t STQ_full_cycles;
00300     counter_t STQ_empty_cycles;
00301 
00302     struct stat_stat_t *commit_stall;
00303 
00304     int flow_count;
00305     int eff_flow_count;
00306     struct stat_stat_t *flow_histo;
00307     struct stat_stat_t *eff_flow_histo;
00308 
00309     tick_t Mop_fetch_slip;
00310     tick_t Mop_fetch2decode_slip;
00311     tick_t Mop_decode_slip;
00312     tick_t Mop_decode2commit_slip;
00313     tick_t Mop_commit_slip;
00314 
00315     tick_t uop_decode2alloc_slip;
00316     tick_t uop_alloc2ready_slip;
00317     tick_t uop_ready2issue_slip;
00318     tick_t uop_issue2exec_slip;
00319     tick_t uop_exec2complete_slip;
00320     tick_t uop_complete2commit_slip;
00321 
00322     /* oracle stats */
00323     counter_t oracle_total_insn;
00324     counter_t oracle_inst_undo;
00325     counter_t oracle_total_uops;
00326     counter_t oracle_uop_undo;
00327     counter_t oracle_total_eff_uops;
00328     counter_t oracle_eff_uop_undo;
00329     counter_t oracle_total_refs;
00330     counter_t oracle_total_loads;
00331     counter_t oracle_total_branches;
00332     counter_t oracle_num_refs;
00333     counter_t oracle_num_loads;
00334     counter_t oracle_num_branches;
00335     counter_t oracle_bogus_cycles;
00336     counter_t MopQ_occupancy;
00337     counter_t MopQ_full_cycles;
00338 
00339     counter_t oracle_resets;
00340   } stat;
00341 
00342 
00343   /*************/
00344   /* FUNCTIONS */
00345   /*************/
00346   core_t(const int core_id);
00347   seq_t new_action_id(void);
00348 
00349   struct uop_t * get_uop_array(const int size);
00350   void return_uop_array(struct uop_t * const p);
00351 
00352   struct odep_t * get_odep_link(void);
00353   void return_odep_link(struct odep_t * const p);
00354 
00355   static void zero_uop(struct uop_t * const uop);
00356   static void zero_Mop(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00357 
00358   protected:
00359 
00360   seq_t global_action_id; /* tag for squashable "actions" */
00361 
00362   static bool static_members_initialized;
00363   static seq_t global_seq; /* This is shared among all cores */
00364   /* to reduce overhead of constantly malloc/freeing arrays to
00365      store the uop flows of all of the Mops, we just maintain our
00366      own free pool.  pool entry i contains arrays with length i. */
00367   static struct uop_array_t * uop_array_pool[MD_MAX_FLOWLEN+2+1]; /* the extra +2+1 is for REP u-jump uops */
00368   static struct odep_t * odep_free_pool;     /* for uop->odep links */
00369   static int odep_free_pool_debt;
00370 
00371   void uop_init(struct uop_t * const uop);
00372 };
